Architecture: Building structures underwater would require different materials and construction techniques. Buildings would need to be designed to withstand the pressure and corrosive environment of water, potentially leading to the development of new architectural styles.

Transportation: Transportation would need to be adapted for underwater life. People would need to learn to navigate underwater vehicles, potentially leading to the development of new forms of transportation and technology.
Food: Underwater life would require a new food source, possibly leading to the development of new agriculture techniques and the cultivation of underwater plants and animals.
Clothing: Clothing would need to be adapted for underwater life, potentially leading to the development of new materials and designs that are both functional and aesthetically pleasing.
Time: Time would be perceived differently underwater. People would need to adapt to a new sense of time, potentially leading to new forms of art and culture.
